intro: Daucus matthiolii, commonly known as the Italian cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Daucus matthiolii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
